sea_biscuit@atlantis.name: sea_biscuit
sea_biscuit@atlantis.desc[0]: A crunchy sea biscuit in the shape of a bone lies on the ground here.

glass_bubble@atlantis.name: glass_bubble
glass_bubble@atlantis.examine:
This glass bubble looks like contains a gas of some sort inside it and is made
out of some durable material similar to glass, tinted a light blue.  It appears
like it could handle an accidental fall, but not an intentional break.
glass_bubble@atlantis.desc[0]: A rather strong glass bubble gently rolls back and forth.

kelp@atlantis.name: kelp
kelp@atlantis.examine:
The limp kelp looks like it might actually be very nutritous if you could 
handle the taste of it.
kelp@atlantis.desc[0]: Some pieces of limp kelp lie here, withering away.

knife@atlantis.desc[1]: A small kelp blade lies partly in the sand, dropped by someone.
knife@atlantis.name: knife
knife@atlantis.examine: It's a short kelp knife used for cutting through tough kelp plants.
knife@atlantis.desc[0]: A keen kelp blade lies here, its serrated edge glinting.

shells_pile@atlantis.name: shells_pile
shells_pile@atlantis.examine: The pile of shells is enormous!  It would take ages to look at them all.

trident@atlantis.desc[1]: A powerful trident lies quietly inside the groove.
trident@atlantis.name: trident
trident@atlantis.examine:
This finely-crafted weapon looks like it is extremely durable and fit for the
Gods themselves.
trident@atlantis.desc[0]: A sharply pointed trident radiating power lies on the ground here.

kelp_2@atlantis.desc[1]: Large strands of kelp grow close together forming a dense wall.
kelp_2@atlantis.name: kelp_2

sea_cucumber@atlantis.name: sea_cucumber
sea_cucumber@atlantis.examine: It's a ripe sea cucumber, ripe and full of flavor.
sea_cucumber@atlantis.desc[0]: A ripe sea cucumber lies here waiting to be eaten.

purple_sponge@atlantis.desc[1]: A squishy purple sponge grows nearby on a small rock.
purple_sponge@atlantis.name: purple_sponge
purple_sponge@atlantis.examine: A sponge in a glorious purple hue, it looks like it could soak up a lot.
purple_sponge@atlantis.desc[0]: A squishy purple sponge lies here ready to soak up something.

silver_triangle@atlantis.name: silver_triangle
silver_triangle@atlantis.examine: It's a beautiful silver triangle that makes a lovely sound when you hit it.
silver_triangle@atlantis.desc[0]: A dainty silver triangle glints merrily on the ground.

hematite_starfish@atlantis.name: hematite_starfish
hematite_starfish@atlantis.examine:
This is obviously a starfish created with great care. It is made of the
semi-precious stone, hematite, and the starfish has a black, shiny, metallic
look to it that reflects some of the nearby light back to you.  It is
wonderful to look at.
hematite_starfish@atlantis.desc[0]: An black shiny starfish with a metallic look lies here.

door_1@atlantis.desc[1]: An ancient stone door remains closed, trapping you inside the altar.
door_1@atlantis.name: door_1
door_1@atlantis.examine: The door provides a flush fit with the surrounding walls.

glued_door_1@atlantis.desc[1]: The door leading outside is glued shut and the Hermit likes it that way.
glued_door_1@atlantis.name: glued_door_1
glued_door_1@atlantis.examine:
The stone door fits unevenly against the frame, overlapping with the outer edge
on one side of the door.
glued_door_1@atlantis.desc[0]: The door leading outside stands invitingly open, suggesting you leave.

violin@atlantis.name: violin
violin@atlantis.examine:
The black carrying case is extremely battered, but the violin inside is in
exquisite shape.  You knew that if you tried to play it, sweet music would pour
forth due to the enchantments on it.  It is truly an instrument of rare 
quality.
violin@atlantis.desc[0]: A violin inside its somewhat battered case lies here on the ground.

historical_marker@atlantis.name: historical_marker
historical_marker@atlantis.examine:
As you clear away the vegetation, you notice the words:
   'This marks the spot where the once-prosperous
    shipping city of Atlantis met with the mainland
    before it disappeared.'
historical_marker@atlantis.desc[0]: A historical marker sits here, covered with vegetation.

pattern@atlantis.name: pattern
pattern@atlantis.examine:
It's a very curious pattern that hangs from the top of the cavern and meets
evenly with the walls and the floor.  Small black and white star shapes form
the pattern but there is a slightly large star pattern in the middle that
appears to be missing.
pattern@atlantis.desc[0]: A black and white star-shaped pattern blocks any further progress.

kelp_1@atlantis.desc[1]: Large strands of kelp grow close together forming a dense wall.
kelp_1@atlantis.name: kelp_1
kelp_1@atlantis.examine: The kelp plants are unusually dense at this spot.

seashell@atlantis.name: seashell
seashell@atlantis.examine:
This large seashell is encrusted with all forms of underwater sea jewels and is
especially covered with black pearls.
seashell@atlantis.desc[0]: A large seashell adorned with precious jewels attracts your attention.

red_coral@atlantis.desc[1]: A small piece of beautiful red coral rests gently against the statue.
red_coral@atlantis.name: red_coral
red_coral@atlantis.examine:
This piece of coral is a brilliant, deep shade of red and would be worth quite
a lot to the right person.
red_coral@atlantis.desc[0]: A small piece of beautiful red coral rests on the ground here.

door@atlantis.desc[1]: An ancient stone door frustrates any further progress to the north.
door@atlantis.name: door
door@atlantis.examine:
This ancient stone door looks like it has been around centuries.  It fits
closely against the surrounding walls making certain no one is going to pry
this door open!  Carved into the door is the figure of an equilateral
triangle.
door@atlantis.desc[0]: An ancient stone door stands wide open allowing passage north.

seahorse@atlantis.name: seahorse
seahorse@atlantis.examine: The poor seahorse is a mess.  Leave it in peace.
seahorse@atlantis.desc[0]: A small seahorse lies in a crumpled heap at your feet.

history_book@atlantis.desc[1]: A clay history book with the cover 'Atlantis' lies open on the table.
history_book@atlantis.name: history_book
history_book@atlantis.examine:
The marked page tells something of the legend of Atlantis: '...and upon the
decline of Poseidon's power, the natives of Atlantis stopped paying respect to
their once revered god.  In retaliation, Poseidon proved he still had a great
deal of raw power by plunging the once teeming surface port of Atlantis into
the sea.  Poseidon claimed that the city would never be redeemed and returned
to Poseidon's grace until some surface dweller came to the defense of Atlantis
and proved that it was worthy once again.  Waiting for that time to come, the
Atlanteans quickly adapted to their new-found environment, quickly establishing
it as a major center of the aquatic realm that it is today.'
history_book@atlantis.desc[0]: A clay history book with the cover 'Atlantis' sits here waiting.

poseidon_statue@atlantis.name: poseidon_statue
poseidon_statue@atlantis.examine:
The statue pictures Poseidon in a commanding stance, motioning towards the sea
with something that appears to be missing.
poseidon_statue@atlantis.desc[0]: A majestic statue of Poseidon stands imposingly in the center of the room.

glued_door@atlantis.desc[1]: An uneven stone door is sealed tight against your actions.
glued_door@atlantis.name: glued_door
glued_door@atlantis.examine:
This stone door fits unevenly against the surrounding walls, overlapping the
wall on the far edge of the door.  But that overlap has been put to good use
because it has been bonded tight against the wall by some incredibly strong
adhesive.
glued_door@atlantis.desc[0]: The door to the hermit's house stands invitingly wide open.

eel@atlantis.desc[1]: An electric eel struggles for his freedom, caught in the kelp.
eel@atlantis.name: eel
eel@atlantis.examine:
It's a rather small eel, only a handspan in length, but it generates a fair
amount of electricity.  It looks at you with adoration for saving it.  It's
sort of cute in a sleek sort of way.
eel@atlantis.desc[0]: An electric eel giving off sparks lies in a puddle of water here.

bottle_water@atlantis.desc[1]: A bottle juts out from behind a piece of wreckage.
bottle_water@atlantis.name: bottle_water
bottle_water@atlantis.examine:
This is a small bottle of 'Bottled Water' that is often popular among human
surface-dwellers and was once manufactured in large quantities by the
Atlanteans in exchange for the bottled air that they so greatly prize.
bottle_water@atlantis.desc[0]: A small bottle labelled 'Bottled Water' sits here.

bottle_air@atlantis.desc[1]: A small bottle lies buried in the sand.
bottle_air@atlantis.name: bottle_air
bottle_air@atlantis.examine:
This 'Bottled Air' is popular among the Merfolk and used to be exchanged
in great abundance ages ago with the surface dwellers.
bottle_air@atlantis.desc[0]: A small bottle with the label 'Bottled Air' sits here.

message@atlantis.name: message
message@atlantis.examine:
The message reads:
		    The crab is expecting you.
		    He will help if you can get to the old grump.

				  -A friend
message@atlantis.desc[0]: A message lies on the counter...it's addressed to you!

barrier@atlantis.name: barrier
barrier@atlantis.examine:
It is a wall completely formed of water.  In it you can see currents stream
through and occassionally a minature whirlpool spins it's way past your eyes as
you watch it.
barrier@atlantis.desc[0]: A watery wall-like barrier blocks any passage to the east.

atlantis43@atlantis.title: Sandy Passage
atlantis43@atlantis.description:
The walls of the castle extend along the western side, save for an opening
off to the west, which is being guarded.  It appears that nobility live in
that section and only come out infrequently, though you notice a great deal
of servants entering.  At the moment a swordfish is exiting the passage
on his way toward the throne room to the east.  Following the walls of
the castle north you will encounter one of the sand towers.

atlantis19@atlantis.title: Kelp Me!
atlantis19@atlantis.description:
You manage to shove your way through the thick growths of the kelp, to
find yourself completely surrounded on all sides by it.  There is so much
of it that it's difficult to see in any real direction.  Thick growths of
the plant form dense walls to the north and east, and seem only slightly
less dense to the west and south.

atlantis56@atlantis.title: Craggy Passage
atlantis56@atlantis.description:
The walls of the cave passage here are very rough and uneven.  The passage
of water through these caves has done little to smooth them out.  Your light
flickers over the silence of the passage in front of you.  You can continue
to swim forward to the east or turn back towards the west.

atlantis23@atlantis.title: End of Side Street
atlantis23@atlantis.description:
This watery passage between buildings ends at a rough sandstone wall.
You notice doors leading north into a well furnished library and to the
south into a spacious temple.

atlantis55@atlantis.title: Hermit's Home
atlantis55@atlantis.description:
You enter a home that is jammed with everything imaginable.  There are
bits of seashell, jade pottery, a small glass jar full of pearls, a cracked
lamp, and a small stone shelf covered with pieces of coral.  Small starfish
lie on the floor of the home and a couple of unusual looking stones are
scattered throughout the room.  On the far wall of the home is an unusual
looking fireplace made of a beautiful pink stone.   Inside it a fire burns
with a blue-green flame.  The smooth walls of the home have thousands of
little hole in them that are packed full of trinkets.  A prize flag from a
sunken pirate ship lies on the floor, pinned down by four huge rocks at
the corners.  It's a cozy little home, albiet somewhat cluttered.

atlantis8@atlantis.title: Ship's Prow
atlantis8@atlantis.description:
The crushed prow of the cargo ship lies half-buried in the sand here.
Fish swim leisurely through holes in the prow while half-hidden creatures
tenatively poke their heads out from the prow to investigate the disturbance
your presence is making through the water.  You can almost make out the
graceful features of a mermaid that adorns the front of the prow but the
features have been eaten away by the currents of the sea.  Underneath the
mermaid you notice a plaque that reads 'The Anemone'.

atlantis1@atlantis.title: Under the Waves
atlantis1@atlantis.description:
What a close shave!  You nearly collided with the cliff face a couple 
of times on the way down and just barely missed the rocks but you are now
safely submerged in water.  It makes you feel strangely bouyant, and you 
find you are able to move freely.  It doesn't look like you will be able
to get back up the cliff face behind you, but heading further down 
appears to still be an option.

atlantis15@atlantis.title: Kelp Bed
atlantis15@atlantis.description:
Long strands of kelp reach up from the sea floor here, sheltering small
schools of fish who make their home here.  The kelp sways in the current,
performing some strange, exotic dance.  The kelp grows more closely together
to the north and east, while it thins out to the west and to the south, near
a large gate.

atlantis66@atlantis.title: Tight Squeeze
atlantis66@atlantis.description:
The tunnel you have just entered hedges in closely upon you but is still
sufficiently large to allow you comfortable passage.  This tunnel also has
the glassy look of the previous passage and your light slides off the
surface in a bright glare.  The tunnel continues to the north into a
dead-end passage, to the west into another corridor and back to the south.

atlantis26@atlantis.title: The Pasture
atlantis26@atlantis.description:
A large area of the sea bed has been marked off with a stone barrier
of some sort, defining the confines of the pasture the sea cows get
to roam in.  There is a section at the far end of the field where kelp
grows for the sea cows to eat.  Looking at the cows it appears that they
are pretty content to be here.

atlantis54@atlantis.title: Secluded Niche
atlantis54@atlantis.description:
The water does end abruptly here, and you drop to the floor, no longer
supported by the water.  Looking around you find yourself in a smooth
cavern, that doesn't look like the rough cave passages you've seen earlier.
The floor of the cavern is covered with sand too, instead of the hard stone
tunnel floor in the rest of the cave passages.  You can jump back into the
water to the north.

atlantis44@atlantis.title: Throne Room
atlantis44@atlantis.description:
The throne against the center of the far wall is the first thing that
captures your attention.  It is carved out of an enormous black pearl.
You probably wouldn't want to meet up with the oyster that created that!
Carved into the surface of the pearl throne is pictures of historical
battles, true loves and tragic losses.  It is a marvel to behold and the
rest of the room no less so.  The room is lit by phosphorescent fish
standing at attention at even intervals throughout the room.  The ceiling
of the room is covered in all the riches of the sea.  Brightly colored
clownfish do tricks for everyone's amusement and there is gaiety all
around.  The only odd thing about the room is that the floor is completely
barren.  Looking down you see nothing but the sea bed below you.

atlantis38@atlantis.title: South End of Main Street
atlantis38@atlantis.description:
You've reached the end of Main Street.  A couple of dolphins pass by you
chattering away happily.  You notice a lobster patching up a hole in a
building bordering the street that was worn away by the currents nearby.
Fish dart this way and that, trying to make up their minds about what
they needed to do.  You notice a small school of fish head off to the west
on a kelp trip.  You can head north up Main Street, west down a short
street or south to the Castle.

atlantis49@atlantis.title: Outside the Garden
atlantis49@atlantis.description:
As you leave the garden behind, you notice the plant life becoming less
well cultivated and that the coral hedges that define the path are becoming
sparse.  Obviously, this path is not used frequently.  Still, you can view
a shy fish or two darting in and out of the coral hedges and your eye catches
a small lobster underneath some of the plants.  You are able to swim between
the hedges west back into the garden or east towards a cave mouth you see
before you.

atlantis41@atlantis.title: Courtyard
atlantis41@atlantis.description:
The courtyard is an odd congomeration of guards, servants, nobility and
tourists.  Off to one side of the courtyard you see a jellyfish talking
to one of the starfish nobles.  Two pagefish dart off to the side at a
summons from their master.  A number of tourists are standing around
looking at all the sights of the castle.  Plus there are peddlers selling
trinkets to those around them and other fish doing acrobatics and feats of
magic.  It is a place full of merriment and activity.  An opening in the
crowd to the west leads to a sand tower and if you push your way you can
swim towards some sort of opening to the east.

atlantis62@atlantis.title: Corner
atlantis62@atlantis.description:
The water-filled cave passage turns a plain corner from the north
towards the west.  The walls are rough and broken, especially near the
floor of the passage where rubble collects at the bottom of the wall,
but the walls still form a gentle curve around the bend.  To the west
you notice a patch of light while heading north heads toward a room
that looks even more cracked than the current one.

atlantis50@atlantis.title: Watery Path
atlantis50@atlantis.description:
As you pass along this path, you are surrounded by a large group of
small, brighly colored yellow fish.  They swirl around you like a
minature tornado then swiftly swim off again into the sea depths.  You can
continue to swim along the path towards the cave to the east or back towards
the garden to the west.

atlantis47@atlantis.title: Messenger Shop
atlantis47@atlantis.description:
This watery shop is quite sparse as the only thing contained inside of
it is a coral countertop for messages.  The rest of the room is empty
save for an up-to-date aquatic calendar on the wall and a few sponge
chairs arranged around the room which seem to have never been used, as
no one is ever kept waiting.  On the counter is a slogan of some sort:
'Speedy's Messenger Service:  Messages delivered while you wait!'.  You
notice at the bottom of the fine print the clause 'This is backed by
a lifetime guarantee--no customer waits longer than their natural life.'
An opening in the building leads back out west onto Main Street.

atlantis5@atlantis.title: Sunken Cargo Ship
atlantis5@atlantis.description:
The inside of the ship looks like it once was as impressive inside as
it was outside.  Tatters of tapestries still cling to the wood, swayed
back and forth by the currents and fish dart here and there, nibbling on
plant life that has attached itself to the inside of the hull.  Something
that resembles a table lies crushed on the sand while various articles are
embedded like strange jewels in the sand, worn away beyond recognition.
Strange crabs peek out at you from under a desk drawer that is propped up
upon a rock, though the desk is nowhere to be seen.  You can tell from some
record books that were trapped under glass that this cargo ship carried
something called "bottled water" that surface-dwellers seemed to like so
much in exchange for "bottled air" that the underwater residents enjoyed.

atlantis61@atlantis.title: Cave Intersection
atlantis61@atlantis.description:
As you approach this intersection you are met by the glow generated
by a large number of phosphorescent plants.  They line all the cracks
and gullies of the walls you pass by and give a soft but somewhat eerie
glow to the water before you.  This intersection of cave passages leads
north into a large crevice, east around a corner and south further along
the corridor.

atlantis73@atlantis.title: Tight Fit
atlantis73@atlantis.description:
Whew!  Good thing you're small or you probably wouldn't have made it
into here.  The walls of this passage are rather narrow and a full sized
human wouldn't be able to fit through here at all.  Luckily that is no problem
for you in your present state.  The passage hedges in on both sides but allows
you to swim to the north and south.

atlantis70@atlantis.title: Air Pocket
atlantis70@atlantis.description:
You find yourself at the bottom of a tube filled by an air pocket.
This air pocket extends for a large distance above you.  The floor is
covered with a small layer of sand that crunches under your feet. On the
southern wall, within jumping distance, is the hole that leads back
towards the front entrance.  On the northern wall there is a very small
hole much further up than the hole on the south wall that you might be able
to toss something up to.

atlantis7@atlantis.title: Gentle Slope
atlantis7@atlantis.description:
The sea bed rises slightly to the east here.  Small creatures scuttle
along the sea floor or glide gracefully through the water.  Larger fish
chase after smaller ones through the water, providing a merry spectacle as
they dart to and fro.  A large ridge of earth blocks any sort of passage
to the south, while the cliff behind you foils any attempt to head back
in that direction.  The bend of the sea bed allows for passage to the north
or up to a slightly raised area to the east.

atlantis33@atlantis.title: North End of Main Street
atlantis33@atlantis.description:
There is less traffic at this end of the street.  The watery passage
curves gently to the east, bordered by buildings on the north and west.
To the east you can two merpeople holding hands entering a lavish garden and
if you look south you can see all the way down Main Street and see the
Castle at the end of it.

atlantis2@atlantis.title: Sinking
atlantis2@atlantis.description:
The blue-green of the sea water embraces you upon your descent.  You
feel the tug and pull of water currents as they gently move you.  Small 
fish dart here and there in front of your eyes, appearing somewhat 
startled by the intrusion upon their domain.  Light from above is 
fading as you descend but your eyes are becoming more adjusted to the 
new environment.  You can either swim up or descend further.

atlantis35@atlantis.title: Outside the Messenger's Shop
atlantis35@atlantis.description:
As you flow along with the rush of aquatic life forms bustling up and
down Main Street you notice a small sign on the outside of a building on the
on the east side of the street proclaiming 'Speedy's Message Service.'  As
you pass outside the doorway, you catch the blur of something that exits
the doorway and returns.  You can investigate the interior of the store to
the east or head along Main Street to the north and south.

atlantis69@atlantis.title: Drop Off
atlantis69@atlantis.description:
The water abruptly ends as you look out into a tube that is completely
dry.  The floor of the tube is a ways below but it looks like you could
survive it if you decided to climb down.  However, it doesn't look like
you wold be able to climb back up if you did so.  Across the tube, farther
up on the opposite wall, you notice a smaller tube that is also filled with
water.

atlantis20@atlantis.title: Kelp Bed
atlantis20@atlantis.description:
Kelp grows in sparse growths here, becoming very thick toward the north.
Something scuttles under your feet, startling you for a moment.  You look
after to see what it was but it's long since scuttled along on it's merry way.
You can head into the thinner kelp to the west, push your way through the
thicker growths to the north or head towards some gates to the south.

atlantis16@atlantis.title: Outside Atlantis
atlantis16@atlantis.description:
Before you is the fabled city of Atlantis.  You can see a large wall made
out of some sand-like substance enclosing the buildings with a large gate in
the middle of the wall directly in front of you.  The water here is ripe with
disturbances in the water from the passage of all sorts of aquatic life that
appear to be entering the city.  The gates are before you to the east while
a kelp bed lies to the north and a large stone outcropping is to the south.
You can also proceed back along the sea bed to the west.

atlantis40@atlantis.title: Sand Tower
atlantis40@atlantis.description:
You stand before one of the Sand Towers you could see from outside the
Castle.  The tower is in slight need of repair because it is starting to
sag a bit under the water's weight but it otherwise holding up well. Looking
through the windows further up the tower you can see a hollow passage leading
all the way up to the top of the tower in which fish and sharks are swimming
up and down, patrolling the tower, viewing the surrounding water.  You are
able to swim back to the east to the courtyard or south to a sandy passage.

atlantis22@atlantis.title: The Atlantis Library
atlantis22@atlantis.description:
You enter a richly furnished library.  It seems the inhabitants of this
town like books a great deal.  The walls are lined with books and the floor
is covered in an unusual pattern of colored coral in a tile-like pattern.
Sturdy stone tables are complimented with comfortable sponge chairs.  You
glance over the books in the library and notice that they are all made of
a clay-like substance that the words have been etched into.  You realize
that the books being heavy also solves the problem of the books floating away.
In all, it's a rather unusual library from the ones you are used to, but is
quite comfortable and inviting.

atlantis32@atlantis.title: Terrarium East
atlantis32@atlantis.description:
You enter into the Atlantis Terrarium.  This is where the Atlanteans
display some of the creatures that live above the water.  Each cage is
made out of something that looks like a clear glass, but stronger.  In
east of the cages in this half you see some of the more mundane animals:
rats, dogs, cats, bats, goats, chicken, racoons, snakes, cows, pigs,
bears and the like on are display here.  A sign near the door indicates
that they obtain air for them from above the waves and that the animals
are treated well.  A sign indicates that there are more creatures to
the west or you may step back outside.

atlantis51@atlantis.title: Before the Cave
atlantis51@atlantis.description:
A large stone cave opening looms before you, casting its shadow upon
the sea bed behind you.  Through the opening you can see nothing but a
lot of darkness and the cave gives you the appearance of being able to
swallow you up.  You can enter into the cave to the east or head back
along the path to the west.

atlantis11@atlantis.title: Sea Floor Rise
atlantis11@atlantis.description:
The sea floor rises gently here, leading up to a barren sandy spot on
top of a small hill.  Off to the east you see the tops of some buildings
sticking up above a sand-packed wall.  The sea bed falls away gradualy from
this spot on the other three sides, leading back toward the cliff face to
the west, towards a small depression to the north and towards a rocky
ridge to the south.

atlantis53@atlantis.title: Craggy Intersection
atlantis53@atlantis.description:
The rough walls of the cave split off into three directions here.  The
passage to the south is very odd looking, as it appears the water ends
abruptly.  A small trickle of light enters in from the passage to the west
and the passage becomes much darker to the east.

atlantis29@atlantis.title: Before Main Street
atlantis29@atlantis.description:
You stand before Main Street, looking at the sights around you.  Nearby,
street vendors are selling souveniers from Atlantis, most of whom are
being ignored.  Small homes line either side of the watery road, made of
some sand-like material.  You see merfolk peer out the windows of their
homes at you.  Fish and merfolk pass by you towards Main Street, where
the traffic seems to split off to the north and south.  You can follow the
stream of traffic or head back west to leave the city.

atlantis17@atlantis.title: Sea Ridge
atlantis17@atlantis.description:
A large outcropping of stone stands imposingly to the south, preventing
travel in that direction.  Bubbles of of air escape around the outcropping,
forced up from somewhere far below the formation.  Fish follow the bubbles
up, playing with them as they quickly rise toward the surface of the water
far above you.  You can follow the outcropping back to the west or head
north along the sea bed.

atlantis48@atlantis.title: Hotel
atlantis48@atlantis.description:
As you float in the lobby of the aquatic hotel you notice that it is
a rather comfortable atmosphere.  Fish swim gracefully through the lobby
on their way to their rooms, a couple of merfolk up at the counter are
checking into the hotel and a couple of swordfish children are chasing
each other through the lobby.  The lobby is tastefully decorated with
carefully selected plantlife and the counter is a lovely shade of blue
coral.  Across the lobby from the counter is a small aquatic piano.  You
aren't quite certain how it operates, but it adds to the inviting atmosphere
of the lobby.  You may swim back out west to Main Street.

atlantis68@atlantis.title: Twisty Turn
atlantis68@atlantis.description:
The walls of this passage twist and turn as they proceed around the
corner.  You swim through something that resemebles a crooked letter 'W'
before you reach the other opening on the far end.  One end of the twisty
passage opens out to the north and the other end exits to the east.

atlantis6@atlantis.title: In Front of the Ship
atlantis6@atlantis.description:
This once proud cargo ship lies in ruins along the bottom of sea.  From
what is left you can tell that it was a very large vessel at one time,
although much of it has washed away.  Barnacles cover the wood and some of
it looks rather unsteady, like the wood remaining was rotten clear through.
Still, parts of it seem to be holding together quite well.  The sea bed
declines slightly to the east and leads into the wreck to the north.

atlantis18@atlantis.title: Shell Pile
atlantis18@atlantis.description:
You have never seen so many shells in your entire life.  It seems this
is where the denizens of Atlantis desposit all their shells when they are
through with them.  Seashells of all colors and varieties dominate the pile
while more exotic ones can be seen scattered throughout.  There is even a
snail shell to one side of the pile that is the size of a small horse, colored
a very lovely shade of pink.  Scattered around the pile are smaller versions
of that shell along with discarded oyster, clam and crab shells.  This would
be quite the treasure if you could bring them all back with you.

atlantis39@atlantis.title: Before the Sand Castle
atlantis39@atlantis.description:
Before you stands a large Sand Castle.  Short, stubby towers stand
out above the rest of the Castle, bright flags of abalone worked into the
top of each.  Through the empty window of each tower you catch glimpses of
shark sentries.  The multiple levels of the castle show activity on each one
and if you watch long enough you notice servants swimming outside the castle
on shortcuts to reach the higher levels instead of passing through the
castle.  You can enter into the courtyard by swimming south or head back
to Main Street to the north.

atlantis21@atlantis.title: Atlantis' Gates
atlantis21@atlantis.description:
Before you are the gates to the Lost City of Atlantis.  The gates
are about twice as high as the average merman and they are wide open, to
allow the stream of aquatic life through the gates.  All forms of life
pour through the gates, on their daily business or just to sightsee.  It
appears that Atlantis has become quite the tourist attraction as it's fame
has grown, so aquatic life forms from all over journey to visit.  You may
swim through the gates to the east, enter a kelp bed to the north or head
back along the sea bed to the west.

atlantis13@atlantis.title: Kelp Bed
atlantis13@atlantis.description:
Kelp grows in abundance here, but sparsely.  You can see large fish
swimming inbetween the strands and smaller aquatic life scuttling along
near the bottom of the plants.  Exotic fish glide quietly in front of
your face, in search of nourishment.  You get an odd feeling of peacefulness
here.

atlantis27@atlantis.title: Terrarium West
atlantis27@atlantis.description:
You have just moved into the exotic section of the Terrarium.  Behind
the glass-like shields you see the creatures that are quite familiar to
you:  orcs, dwarves, gnolls, insect-like creatures, a family of ogres, a
captured demon and even a baby dragon!  The aquatic tourists are especially
interested in this place, with all the life forms they never see otherwise.
You feel fortunate that you aren't one of the displays.

atlantis63@atlantis.title: Sea Weed
atlantis63@atlantis.description:
You're not certain how it managed to get here, but the passage is
blocked by a large growth of sea weed.  It completely surrounds the tunnel
around you and chokes off any further passage.  If you want you can attempt
to push your way through it to the east or west, or head back up the
corridor with a faint glow to the north.

atlantis65@atlantis.title: Smooth Turn
atlantis65@atlantis.description:
While the tunnels you have been recently seeing have been extremely rough,
you have just entered a tunnel that is completely smooth.  The sides of the
tunnel have been rubbed smooth by some force.  Touching the walls gives a
glassy feeling to them, even though you know that the walls around you are
stone.  You can swim either north or east along the corridor.

atlantis64@atlantis.title: Alcove
atlantis64@atlantis.description:
It seems that other life has been able to enter the cave and survive
here because this small alcove is completely covered in sponge.  Sponges of
all colors can be found here.  This cavern might actually be a lot of fun if
you haven't been beset by sea weed plants, giant squids, were far underwater
and inside a dark watery cave not knowing what was going to happen.  The
passage leads back out to the west.

atlantis71@atlantis.title: Watery Crack
atlantis71@atlantis.description:
You are in a low-ceilinged, somewhat small, narrow passage.  Behind you
the water ceases in a clean wall as it meets an air tube.  Looking down
the tube you see a long drop with an odd shaped human-type creature at
the bottom of the shaft.  It's a long drop and if you tried to jump into
the tube you would surely die but if you dropped something, it would probably
land safely.  The watery passage continues on further to the north.

atlantis24@atlantis.title: Poseidon's Temple
atlantis24@atlantis.description:
Fish dart around the wide open spaces of this temple.  Large slabs of
a blue-green stone form the walls of this octagonal shaped room.  In the
center of the chamber a large statue of Poseidon dominates the room.  The
floor is covered in a criss-cross pattern of the same sort of material as
that which makes up the walls.  Occassionally, pious aquatic life come and
offer their respects and sometimes leave a gift at the base of the statue.
As you watch, a small shark enters the temple, bows a fin toward the statue
and then leaves a small piece of beautiful red coral in respect.

atlantis3@atlantis.title: Sea Bottom Approach
atlantis3@atlantis.description:
As you travel still further down you see the sea floor begin to 
approach you.  You can begin to make out some forms on the sea 
floor below.  Off to the north you can see the ruins of a ship 
while off to the east a small town rests peacefully beneath the waves.
Beyond the small town you can see the opening of a large cave mouth.  
You can swim upward or descend down to the sea bed.

atlantis31@atlantis.title: Short Street
atlantis31@atlantis.description:
This short waterway ends abruptly after a short distance.  You see
a large number of tourists heading through a door to the south and hear
a coughing sound coming from the doorway to the north.  A few sharks also
emerge from the doorway to the south, making gestures as if something
were jumping around inside.

atlantis74@atlantis.title: Before the Door
atlantis74@atlantis.description:
You swim down the corridor and stop abruptly at a large door.  It is a
massive stone door that matches perfectly with the stone surrounding it.
No way to pry this one open!  The stone around the door and along the walls
is slipperly smooth and reflects an ghostly glow to your eyes from somewhere.
The only exit is either through the door somehow or back down the corridor
from which you came.

atlantis10@atlantis.title: Sea Floor
atlantis10@atlantis.description:
The bed of the sea seems to stretch on for days.  Outcroppings of rock
jut up from the bottom of the sea floor while plant life atop it sways
gently to the swell of the current.  Clumps of rocks form barriers that
smaller fish hide behind warily.  Larger fish swim slowly around, looking
for prey, or perhaps just a good place to hover quietly for a few moments.
Bright colors glitter off of the rocks and fish, providing a delight to
your eyes.  Off to the east lies a kelp bed and the sea bed heads off to
the north, south and west.

atlantis28@atlantis.title: Side Street
atlantis28@atlantis.description:
This street continues along between buildings, providing a fairly
wide corridor.  The buildings on either side seem to be made mostly of
a sand-like substance.  The building at the end of the street on the left
looks like it is made from a blue-green material that looks like marble
and you guess that it is an important building.  Fish dart past you
on their way to get to somewhere while you're deciding where to go.  You
may return back to Main Street to the east or toward the end of the
street to the West.

atlantis42@atlantis.title: Intersection
atlantis42@atlantis.description:
You've reached an intersection just off of the Courtyard.  There is an
opening in the buildings, leading off into what looks like servant's quarters,
but it is being guarded.  Merfolk bustle mostly out of the opening, heading
out towards the throne room to the south.  A few others cross the courtyard
to the west on other business.

atlantis75@atlantis.title: The Lost Altar
atlantis75@atlantis.description:
You have entered upon a simple altar.  Against the far wall of the room is
a small block altar that appears to be part of the wall that extends out
into the room.  On top of the altar is a horizontal groove.  Above the altar,
carved into the wall is an icon that looks very much like a trident.  Under
the icon is the inscription 'When this trident is returned shall the city of
Atlantis be redeemed.'

atlantis9@atlantis.title: Sandy Spot
atlantis9@atlantis.description:
The sea bed declines into a shallow depression here.  The water eddys
around you in a circular pattern, catching fish in the current and tossing
them about a bit before they regain control.  The currents whirl around
the depression, disturbing the sand.  Off to the east you see a large kelp
bed while the prow of a large ship lies in wreck to the north.  Far off
to the west is the abrupt rise of a cliff face while the sea bed winds
gently of to the south.

atlantis60@atlantis.title: Watery Passage
atlantis60@atlantis.description:
The floor of this passage is strewn with large chunks of stone and the
walls are scored with large cracks, like something powerful had been
hitting them fiercely.  Rubble litters the floor and several other pieces
look like they have been crushed into smaller pieces by a tremendous
force.  It doesn't look like a very safe place to be floating around in.
You can swim into a large crevice off to the west or around a corner to
the south.

atlantis34@atlantis.title: North Main Street
atlantis34@atlantis.description:
As you enter this section you can see a group of fish that appear to be
playing a game called "airball" where they bat around an air-filled ball
with their fins and try and knock it into a couple of enclosures.  It looks
like they're having a lot of fun.  Passages between the buildings lead
north towards the end of the street, west down a short street and back
south along the rest of Main Street.

atlantis46@atlantis.title: Octopus' Garden
atlantis46@atlantis.description:
A glorious sight to behold is the Octopus' Garden.  Streaks of color
come from arranged anemones and colored plant life.  Statues of coral
are arranged tastefully about the garden and small pathways lead in
winding circles through all the colorful plants.  Hedges of darker coral
block off your view from certain sections which, once beyond the hedge,
provide even more spectacular views due to the partitioning.  Lovers swim
along the paths through the plants and tourists come from all over to
view this beautiful sight.

atlantis14@atlantis.title: Kelp Bed
atlantis14@atlantis.description:
Kelp begins to grow thick here, beginning to obstruct your view of the
surroundings.  You push your way through the plants, finding your bearings.
The small forest of kelp hedges in on all sides but thins out slightly
toward the north, west and south.  If you wish to try, you can attempt to
force your way through the more tightly growning kelp to the east.

atlantis52@atlantis.title: Inside the Cave Mouth
atlantis52@atlantis.description:
A small amount of light streams in from the water outside.  In front of
you is a passage through the stone of the cave, roughly worn into the
side of the stone by the passage of water.  It appears that the water
broke through into the rough natural caves that were inside the stone here.
These natural caves, now filled with water, lead further inside or you
can swim out the cave mouth once again to the west.

atlantis45@atlantis.title: Octopus' Home
atlantis45@atlantis.description:
This home is extremely immaculate.  Everything has its proper place
and is stored there neatly.  The pots are all put away, the gardening
utensils are all clean and stored in their rack, the bed is made and the
floor is swept (as much as the sea floor can be swept, anyway).  The
entire household is spotless which isn't overly surprising since its
inhabitant has eight arms to do everything with.

atlantis59@atlantis.title: Crevice
atlantis59@atlantis.description:
The crack that serves as the entrance appears to have been ripped open from
the surrounding wall and the space behind it has been made into a lair for
a giant squid.  Bones of various creatures litter the floor of the crevice and
it doesn't look much like a pleasant place to remain long.  You can leave this
place to the east or towards a small glimmer to the south.

atlantis58@atlantis.title: Watery Tunnel
atlantis58@atlantis.description:
Your light throws off odd shadows upon the walls and lends an eerie tint
to the water before you.  Ahead of you other shadows seem to be moving, but
perhaps it's just a trick of your imagination.  You can continue on further
to the south into the shadows or north back around the corner.

atlantis30@atlantis.title: Merfolk Home
atlantis30@atlantis.description:
You enter a cozy little home made out of the sand-like substance you've
viewed elsewhere.  The home is rather small, with some sleeping beds on
the floor to one side neatly arranged.  They appear to be made out of kelp.
A small cooking arrangement is along the far wall and a door leads west
outside.  A heavy table made of stone dominates the room and you notice
a note on the table held down by a rock.  It says 'Went to work luring
adventurers in the High Priest's Quarters again.  Have a good day at the
Hotel.  All my love.  -Mara'  Beyond this, the home is very clean and sparse.
You can swim south back to the street or west to the pasture where the family
keeps their cows.

atlantis36@atlantis.title: Watery Intersection
atlantis36@atlantis.description:
You are standing in the main hub of Atlantis.  All sorts of forms
glide, wiggle or swim past you at breakneck speeds trying to reach where
they are going.  There are a few fish here and there swimming leisurely
along the side of the watery street, looking into all the shops as they
pass.  You notice that the windows in the buildings are simply holes
cut out from the side of them with nothing covering them, so occassionally
a fish will dart through one of the windows in the building as well
as the larger ones needed for larger species, like the merfolk.  You can
head north or south along Main Street or west to leave the city.

atlantis72@atlantis.title: Small Passage
atlantis72@atlantis.description:
The rock of the cave narrows slightly as you swim down this corridor.
It is still quite large for you but it appears you're being funneled
somewhere ahead.  You are able to swim further down the passage to the
north or return to the south.

atlantis37@atlantis.title: Outside the Hotel
atlantis37@atlantis.description:
As you swim along Main Street you see a plaque outside one building
indicating that it is a hotel.  You notice all sorts of aquatic creatures
enter and leave the hotel, some of whom can barely swim through the door,
they're so exhausted from sight-seeing.  As you pass outside the Hotel,
you hear the strains of something that sounds like piano coming from inside
the hotel, but it sounds odd and somewhat muffled.  You can enter the hotel
to the east or head north and south on Main Street.

atlantis57@atlantis.title: Cave Corner
atlantis57@atlantis.description:
The cave turns a corner here, leading from the west to the south.  The
water here seems very dead as there are few vibrations in the water and you
can feel very little current passing by you.  You also take notice that you
haven't seen any aquatic life since you've entered the cave.  The thought
makes you shiver slightly.  The cave leads on into darkness to the south
or back out towards the cave mouth to the west.

atlantis4@atlantis.title: Sea Bed
atlantis4@atlantis.description:
Actually, it doesn't resemble a bed at all.  As the water swirls 
about you, you sway under its pressure and feel the crunch of sand
under your feet as you attempt to keep your footing.  The cliff 
face behind you is covered with all sorts of sea life and riddled 
full of holes, ripe for the dwellings of small animals.  The sea 
bed stretches out in front of you to the north, east and south.

atlantis25@atlantis.title: Entrance to Atlantis
atlantis25@atlantis.description:
So here it is.  The Lost City of Atlantis.  Upon viewing it, the city
actually doesn't look all that impressive.  It seems that the legends
about it have been so blown out of proportion that the real reason for
it's being here may have been lost, and instead lavish stories have been
created to explain it.  Now it looks like a somewhat small village with
a rather large aquatic tourist population drawn here by the legend of the
city.  All forms of aquatic life bustle about through the gates on their
own agendas.  You can leave the city through the gates behind you to the
west or continue towards Main Street to the east.

atlantis12@atlantis.title: Sea Ridge
atlantis12@atlantis.description:
A large rock formation juts out from the sea floor here, making a large
impenetrable wall to the south.  Colorful plant life sticks to the wall,
making it look like the outcropping has polka-dots if you stand back far enough
from it.  Your eye catches a glimpse of something moving in the wall, then
loses track of it.  You can swim back north or follow the wall to the east.

atlantis67@atlantis.title: Serpent's Lair
atlantis67@atlantis.description:
The walls of this dead-end cave are also glass smooth.  You realize
from this lair that the walls you recently saw were due to the serpent
rubbing against them in passage all these years.  It probably crawled into
these caves for food then grew too large for the passages until it
became trapped inside.  This dead-end passage is completely barren and
smooth due to the vast amount of time the serpent spent sleeping here.
You can swim back to the passageway to the south.

crab@atlantis.name: crab
crab@atlantis.description: A crotchety old Hermit Crab sits here, just wanting to be left alone.

lobster@atlantis.name: lobster
lobster@atlantis.description: A lobster hides in the kelp, ready to attack!

seaserpent@atlantis.name: seaserpent
seaserpent@atlantis.description: A massive Sea Serpent appears to be trapped here and hasn't eaten in a while.

manatee@atlantis.name: manatee
manatee@atlantis.description: A large Manatee stands here, gawking at the sights of the Castle.

aquarian@atlantis.name: aquarian
aquarian@atlantis.description: Aquarian the Merman priest tends to the shrine of Poseidon.

speedy@atlantis.name: speedy
speedy@atlantis.description: Speedy Snail asks if you saw him leave and return as you walked in?

school@atlantis.name: school
school@atlantis.description: A school of brightly colored fish dart around you.

shrimp@atlantis.name: shrimp
shrimp@atlantis.description: A shrimp moves around the garden mumbling 'I am NOT short!'.

emperess@atlantis.name: emperess
emperess@atlantis.description: The mermaid Emperess sits on her throne ruling over her aquatic subjects.

ray@atlantis.name: ray
ray@atlantis.description: A blind Manta Ray is at the piano, singing blues.

seadog@atlantis.name: seadog
seadog@atlantis.description: An ole sea dog is here, sniffing along the ground for something to eat.

merman@atlantis.name: merman
merman@atlantis.description: A Merman is here taking reservations for the hotel.

seahorse@atlantis.name: seahorse
seahorse@atlantis.description: A small, oddly shaped, seahorse swims quietly in the passage.

seacow@atlantis.name: seacow
seacow@atlantis.description: A large sea cow munches quietly on some of the kelp nearby.

octopus@atlantis.name: octopus
octopus@atlantis.description: A gentle Octopus is taking a break from tending her garden.

merboy@atlantis.name: merboy
merboy@atlantis.description: A small merchild is in bed ill...he doesn't like the sea.

puffer@atlantis.name: puffer
puffer@atlantis.description: A Puffer swells up in exasperation because you didn't return your library book!

squid@atlantis.name: squid
squid@atlantis.description: An enormous Squid flails his tentacles at you.

seaweed@atlantis.name: seaweed
seaweed@atlantis.description: A large growth of seaweed blocks the passage here.

urchin@atlantis.name: urchin
urchin@atlantis.description: A scruffy-looking Sea Urchin is here begging.
